parameters: A flood of goopy Slimes charge you.
Prepare to fight for your life!
The Slimes retreat for a moment.
You run away before they can mount a counterattack.
You enter the marshy area that is home to the Slimes...
The water seems... alive...
Suddenly, it moves up on to the shore.
A pair of beady eyes look back at you with interest.
Gate
Gate
"Hey, you're that diplomat adventurer, right?"
"I'm Gate, and it's very nice to meet you!"
"I was the one voted to hear you out."
"So then, speak! What are your terms?"
You explain the Mayor's terms once again.
Gate listens throughout, by the end looking a bit upset.
Something set off alarm bells for them while you talked.
You ask if everything is OK.
Gate
Gate
"A few things are wrong, actually."
"First, we are not warriors."
"Dragon forced us into battle."
"We seek peaceful lives as farmers and chefs."
Gate
Gate
"Second, since many of us wish to be chefs..."
"It's unreasonable to have us so far away."
"Please, can you set things right for us?"
"Tell the Mayor our terms."
Gate
Gate
"And tell him these are NOT negotiable!"
You walk away, thinking of ways to convince the Mayor.
Gate
Slime Armymen
"Slorp Slorp"
*You see over a dozen Slimes heading your way.*
*One cuts ahead of all the others*
You've defeated the entire marsh's worth of slimes.
You're covered in goo, but there's no time to waste!
You pack your bags and head to the Harpies.
There are 15 more hours until the Blood Moon
You arrive at the Slime marsh.
You're searching for one very particular Slime.
They seemed to be a person of interest...
At least, for learning about their race.
Slimes start to surround you, looking curious.
You hear murmured conversations between them as you search.
Words like "Diplomat" and "Adventurer" spring out at you.
Suddenly, you catch a familiar voice in the crowd.
Gate
Gate
"Isn't that the hero who united all the races?"
*They look you up and down*
"Hey, it IS you! What are you doing back here?"
"Not that I'm not happy to see you, I mean."
You tell Gate that you're curious about Slime culture.
Their face lights up at your words.
The crowd of Slimes gets louder and more excited.
Apparently not many people want to learn about them.
Gate
Gate
*They turn to the crowd*
"OK, OK, everyone. Back it up!"
"Give our friend some room to breathe, please."
"Our hero asked ME specifically, not you."
The crowd slowly dissipates back into the water.
The first question you have, of course, is how they breathe.
Are they amphibious or is there more to it?
And what exactly IS a slime? Like, what are they made of?
Gate
Gate
"One question at a time, please..."
"Though, I may be able to answer both..."
"With one thing: Magic!"
"Us slimes are basically the result of waste."
Gate
Gate
"When warriors battle using magic..."
"Some of that magic later seeps underground."
"Combine that with a lot of water and time..."
"And you've got yourself a Slime!"
Gate
Gate
"The time it takes varies based on two things:"
"The amount of magic, and the amount of water."
"However, usually it takes about..."
"One to two hundred years."
Gate
Gate
"But of course, after one Slime is made..."
"It can reproduce by itself as long as there's some water!"
"That's why we call this Marsh our home..."
"It has everything we need to create more of us!"
You listen to all this, fascinated.
You know that no human has ever talked to a Slime like this.
They'd tried to TAME them as pets, but never succeeded.
To have a one-on-one with a Slime, and learn of its origin?
That was something truly, truly special.
One thing, though, was on your mind.
You ask Gate if Slimes ever have relationships.
Is there any romance, or just strong bonded friendships?
Gate
Gate
"Well, OK, we DO have romances, yes."
"However, a Slime romance isn't taken lightly."
"We bond significantly with someone..."
"Before we even BEGIN to think about that."
Gate
Gate
"For a Slime to profess their love to you..."
"That means more than mere words describe."
"Our race has a term for it: Ohshubi."
"We may have multiple Ohshubis..."
Gate
Gate
"But each is a forever-bond."
"Each Ohshubi is valued as highly as...
"Well, as highly as you may value a God."
"However, we do not see Ohshubis as Gods."
Gate
Gate
"They are people, but we love them as Gods."
"Just as your people may war over Gods..."
"So, too, do our people war over Ohshubis."
"So be careful what Slimes you hurt..."
Gate
Gate
"You may one day find yourself at war over it."
"No one wants war, but we FIGHT for Ohshubis."
"They are the most precious of values."
"..At least, in our culture."
You thank Gate for the explanation, and decide to head home.
They'd given you much to think about...
Love so powerful an entire species goes to war over it?
A mortal creature being revered as much as a God?
AND WHO COULD HAVE GUESSED THAT HUMANS CREATED SLIMES?
So much to think about...
And, honestly, you think you'll visit again...
This time, to learn more about Gate themself.
You arrive back at the Marsh, searching once again for Gate.
The Slimes once again surround you, whispering.
Among the usual "Diplomat" and "Adventurer" are other names:
"Scholar" and "Gate's friend" jump out at you in the crowd.
Gate appears from the crowd, clearly happy to see you.
Once again, he shoos the crowd away.
You mention the fact that his kind must be very curious.
Gate rolls his eyes and speaks plainly to you:
Gate
Gate
"Not really. We just don't get visitors here."
"At least, not ones that want to talk."
"The swarm is a defense mechanism."
"Weak alone, strong together kind of thing."
You nod, understanding the situation instantly.
Slimes are considered mindless pests by most humans.
The few races that DO associate with them...
Usually just use Slimes as training dummies for the newbies.
Gate
Gate
"Well, at least you understand here..."
"Although, fixing our whole mess..."
"Would definitely require more than just that."
"But I wouldn't ask such things of you."
You tell Gate that they have piqued your curiousity.
What is their life like? What are their dreams?
Do they have an Ohshubi? Do they care about romance at all?
So many questions tumble out of your mouth, rapid-fire.
Gate
Gate
"Slow down so I can answer, haha!"
"I'm glad I interest you, but SHEESH!"
*They laugh when you apologize*
"It's not a big deal, everyone has flaws."
Gate
Gate
"My life is really boring, honestly."
"I was a chef before Dragon recruited us."
"Due to the nature of Slime cooking..."
"That was outlawed in Dragon's army."
Gate
Gate
"Basically, Slime is very sweet."
"It has all the benefits of human sugar..."
"With none of the downsides of it!"
"In fact, it's very healthy for you!"
Gate
Gate
"So when Slimes cook, we jump inside the pot."
"Then, we stir the meal with our bodies."
"SOOO why would Dragon outlaw Slime cooking?"
"Well... it's because we are also Dragon prey."
Gate
Gate
"...And Goblin prey, Orc prey..."
"Well, basically every species except for two:"
"Harpies and Minotaurs don't eat meat."
"Anyway, the Dragon King was aware of this."
Gate
Gate
"He thought that Slime cooking might, well..."
"Kinda trigger the other species to attack."
"You know, in times of war, food gets low."
"And when food is low, we're the first to go."
Gate
Gate
"So, yeah, I was made a soldier by the King."
"Then, when you came along, well..."
"I was voted Diplomat. The rest is history."
"Now the war is over, and I will reopen!"
Gate
Gate
"...That is, once I find a good market."
"Other Slimes have already taken up shop here."
"I'm sure I could beat out competition..."
"But I don't want to ruin any businesses."
Gate
Gate
"I've been considering one place..."
"Maybe the human town could use a Slime chef?"
"Especially with their addiction to sugar..."
"That REALLY unhealthy stuff just HAS to go."
You agree with Gate, citing a study done by some medics.
The study had found sugar to be highly addictive, as well.
So not only is it a silent killer, it's also hard to quit.
Gate shivers in disgust.
Gate
Gate
"That seals it! I'm setting up a booth there!"
"Just something small, maybe put it..."
"Right outside the entrance to your town?"
"Yeah, that sounds perfect! Thanks!"
The two of you continue to talk about Gate's business.
You come up with all kinds of ideas together for dishes.
However, one thing is still on you mind...
Something you realize Gate avoided talking about...
Gate never answered your question about having an Ohshubi.
On your way to the Marsh, you notice Gate setting up shop.
They weren't right outside the town, though...
Rather, they were at a crossroads between several towns...
The Orc, Harpy, Goblin, Slime, Minotaur, and Dragon towns.
You realize this is actually much better for business.
Travellers who want a hot meal could easily stop here...
And traders could take advantage of the closer location.
You find yourself impressed with Gate's business ideas.
Gate
Gate
*huff* *puff*
"Hey, friend?" *huff* "Can I get some help?"
*They struggle to lift a large wooden sign*
"...Please?"
You quickly move to help. Combining your efforts...
The two of you manage to finish setting up.
You ask Gate why they changed their mind.
Did they get inspired when reaching the crossroads?
Gate
Gate
"Honestly? The human guards said I couldn't."
"I got to your town. They questioned me."
"When they found out why I was there..."
"They threw me out, calling me 'filth.'"
Your look of excitement changes to disgust, then anger...
Finally, you land on determination.
You ask Gate if they can identify the guards for you.
Gate shakes their head, smiling softly.
Gate
Gate
"There is no need, friend. It all ended well."
"I get a better spot..."
"And don't have to deal with bigotry as often."
"That's a win-win in my book!"
You tell Gate it's not right. Something should be done.
Again, Gate shakes their head. You ask why.
Gate ponders on the question for a moment.
Perhaps they'd never considered reflecting on why's.
Gate
Gate
"I guess because forgiveness is in my nature."
"Without that natural adherance to such..."
"I never would have forgiven myself."
"I made a mistake, long ago. But I'm alive."
Gate
Gate
"I trust you enough by now to tell the story."
"That is, if you care about it at all."
"I don't mind either way, myself."
"It still hurts just as much as it did then..."
Gate
Gate
"However, what's done is done."
"There's no going back, no matter what I want."
"No matter how much I wish I hadn't..."
"I hadn't hurt her like that..."
Gate's demeanor has changed significantly.
They look depressed, sad, and... heartbroken?
You think of how they didn't answer some questions before.
You say one word, phrased as a question: Ohshubi?
Gate
Gate
"...Yes, my first and only Ohshubi."
"Her name is Polly. She's a Harpy officer."
"At least, I hope she is..."
Gate
Gate
"I don't even know if she still lives or not."
"I haven't seen her in so long..."
"I hurt her in an attempt to protect her."
"I didn't realize my mistake until too late."
Gate
Gate
"The last time we talked, she was very young."
"When I first met her..."
"She had only been of-age for a few months."
"She was naive and innocent."
Gate
Gate
"We were together for three years."
"I wanted to propose to her."
"However, I could only see her as her age."
"I thought she needed more time."
Gate
Gate
"So... I gave it to her. Time, that is."
"I broke up with her...
"So she could focus on growing up."
"It was the hardest thing I've ever done."
Gate
Gate
"She fell apart after that, so I heard."
"She almost got kicked out of officer ranks."
"I realized that she WAS growing, and that..."
"I had accidentally ruined that."
Gate goes silent. You think back to the Polly you met.
Were they, perhaps, the same person?
Only one way to find out.
You look at Gate and ask a question: Polly the... parrot?
Gate
Gate
"Y-yes... Sh-She..."
"Wait, you've met her? She's alive!?"
"How is she? Did she ever mention me?"
"PLEASE tell me she's still an officer!"
You assure Gate that Polly is doing well...
Although, you always thought she seemed a little down...
Especially whenever Slimes were mentioned.
You suggest that perhaps they should talk to her.
Gate
Gate
"No. No. I can't. It's... She's better off..."
*They take a breath and think for a second*
"Yeah, I guess I haven't forgiven myself..."
"At least, fully, that is."
You mention to Gate that Polly says hi. She misses them.
Polly has done really well for herself recently.
Perhaps now that she's older and more mature...
The two could rekindle their love, or at least be friends.
Gate
Gate
"Friends, maybe. But never again lovers."
"I wouldn't blame her if she held a grudge."
"But... thank you for delivering her message."
"I'll get in touch with her, when I can."
Gate
Gate
"Enough sad stories! Hungry mouths to feed!"
"I want to open this place up tomorrow!"
"Soooo let's get COOKING!"
The two of you spend the rest of the day cooking together.
As you near the crossroads where Gate set up shop...
Fear grips you as you look around. The bakery is in ruins.
The wooden sign is snapped in pieces.
The pots are dented, and scattered all over the place...
...And it looks like nearly everything is covered in food.
But what REALLY scares you, as you get closer?
A puddle of slime covered in and filled with salt...
And Gate nowhere to be seen.
You walk to the puddle of slime...
You remember Gate told you that Slimes are water and magic.
Salt... salt must be a huge weakness for Slimes.
Is Gate... are they....? You drop to your knees.
You hear a whimper as you do so.
Quickly getting up, you see Gate's eyes appear in the slime.
They're alive, but barely. Eyeballs half-shut...
And floating in the nearly-solid slime puddle.
Thinking quickly, you pour out your entire canteen.
Not enough, but any little bit counts.
You scoop up as much liquid slime as you can in the canteen.
You then scoop up the more solid slime with Gate's eyes.
You grab your horse and push it to full gallop to the Marsh.
Usually it'd take another day to reach there.
Gate had no such time, but you were determined to try.
Suddenly, your canteen starts to glow purple-pink.
Time slows around you. Reality warps and bends.
In a flash, you're in the middle of the Marsh.
What was morning is now midnight.
But you can't reflect on that now. Gate needs you.
You open the canteen and pour its entirety into the water.
Please don't be too late. Please don't be too late. Please-
The glowing, oozing slime condenses in the water.
You notice the level drops about an inch as it's soaked up.
You watch, on edge, for about 45 minutes as Gate recovers.
Still injured, but able to speak now, Gate looks at you.
There's something in their eyes... mesmerizing you.
Something about Gate has made you so happy so far...
And now? Gate is dying, and all you can do is watch...
Hoping against hope that you did enough to save them.
You stare in their eyes with fear, anguish, and hope.
They stare back at you, seeming to realize something now.
Gate
Gate
"Would... you go out with me..?"
*Gate passes out as you cry and nod*
You notice some Slimes drawn to your crying.
They see Gate, and one of them comes forward.
They reassure you that Gate will be ok. You did it.
You saved them. They just need to rest and recover now.
You nod, wiping away tears.
You know you can't sleep in the Marsh.
You decide to head home to rest, and visit soon.
Very, very soon.
When you return to the Marsh, the Slimes converge.
However, this time, they're not chatting in hushed tones.
They're cheering your name, and you soon see why.
A familiar blue figure, albeit smaller than usual, appears.
Gate
Gate
"I can't believe you saved me..."
"I really thought it was over. Then... you..."
*They're at a loss for words*
"Please, let me take you to my home."
You nod, pure joy on your face. They made it. Gate is alive.
You're relieved and overjoyed and have so many emotions...
You just grin like a mad fool as Gate takes your hand.
They lead you past the crowd and to a large lake.
Gate
Gate
"This is where I go to start Mitosis."
"Mitosis is a very personal thing."
"Just as your form of procreation is for you."
"To show someone your home is to show trust."
Gate
Gate
"I trust and care for you, darling."
"You saved my life, of course."
"I was scared to admit my feelings before now."
"But your actions speak louder than any words."
As they speak, Gate is making a small campfire.
They expertly light it and start cooking.
You watch them stir the pot with their body, giggling.
You're just so happy to be here with them.
Gate
Gate
"Here, darling, try this."
*They feed you a spoon of something wonderful*
"I'm glad you like it. I do know though..."
"You want to know what the heck happened."
You freeze, flashing back to a few days before.
Slowly nodding, raging anger suddenly grows from within you.
Whoever hurt your beloved will PAY WITH BLOOD!
Gate shushes you, putting their slimy hand on yours.
Gate
Gate
"I will tell you, but you must promise..."
"Whatever you do, do not kill them."
"They are guards, and..."
"They were only following orders."
Guards? Orders? Only one man could hold such power to...
to...
...The Mayor!
Gate
Gate
"Please, don't go inciting violence!"
"...Or, rather, acting violently to violence."
"That will just cause more trouble for Slimes."
"The only way we'll win is if we change minds."
Gate
Gate
"Look, I'm not well-known to humans..."
"But, well, YOU are."
"So I think if you can show humans we're OK..."
"Maybe it will stop the violence!"
You sit down wearily, and tell Gate you'll think on it.
For now, you have another question bothing your mind:
What was that pink-purple glow? And HOW did you manage...
to travel... THROUGH TIME?
Gate
Gate
*They laugh*
"Simple math, darling. Simple math."
"Water, magic, and time together equals Slime."
"Sooo Slime minus water equals..."
You think for a brief second before it hits you:
Time magic. Being low on water causes time magic to release.
That makes you wonder one more thing:
How does that effect slime in food?
Gate
Gate
"Ahh, I told you it was healthy, yes?"
"The reason for that is because of one thing:"
"Slime prevents aging, giving longer life."
"It doesn't completely rid of aging deaths..."
Gate
Gate
"Buuut it slows the process down a little."
"That way, your body stays youthful, longer!"
"Ahhh, but the stew is done, darling!"
"Eat, eat, enjoy the wonderful evening!"
The two of you spend the night together.
Many cuddles and conversations are had.
Much food is eaten.
You just enjoy each other's company the whole time..
As you make your way toward the swamp, you spot two guards.
They're searching the wreckage of Gate's shop.
It looks like they're picking up the leftover slime.
This can't have good intentions.
You put your hand on the pommel of your sword.
You leave your horse nearby and walk up to the guards.
Your body tenses, ready for anything.
They turn to look at you, and instantly recognize your face.
People3
Guards
"Hey, you're that diplomat adventurer!"
"Don't mind us, pal, we're just cleaning crew."
"Someone set up a shop here, you see..."
"Then some Slime guy came and ruined it!"
People3
Guards
"At least the shop owner seems to be alive."
"...Wherever he is. No idea who it was."
"Just haven't found any bodies except Slimey."
"Why you got that face, huh? Everything OK?"
Your blood feels boiling hot, but your words come out cold:
Did. You. Hurt. Gate?
Are. You. The. Ones. Who. Tried. To. Kill. Him?
Tell. Me. Now.
People3
Guards
"H-Hey, man. We're just the cleanup crew."
"The night shift guys are the ones who saw it."
"At least, that's the story we were told."
"P-Please, man. I-I'm sorry, but it wasn't us!"
Your hand grips your sword tight as you close your eyes.
Your mind can't stop flashing back to the scene.
To the look in Gate's eyes as they just waited to die.
But their words echo through your mind, too...
Gate
Gate's Image
"Violence is not the answer. Understanding is."
You take a series of long, hard, deep breaths.
Without even a glance back at the guards...
You go back to your horse, mount it, and ride to the Marsh.
The Mayor WILL pay for his crimes. But not today.
Gate is already standing at the entrance.
They ask you why you look pale.
You explain, still shaking from the flashbacks.
Gate holds your hand tight, and stares into your eyes.
Gate
Gate
"Calm, calm, it'll be OK..."
"I'm here, we're alive, and together..."
"And better yet, Ohshubi..."
"I still love you."
You hold Gate tightly.
They take you back to their home once again.
You two cuddle and eat and talk the rest of the day.
By the time you leave, you know what Gate meant...
...When they talked about loving someone as a God...
Gate
Gate
"Welcome back, Ohshubi! You've been busy!"
"And now you're Dragon's Mate, of all things!"
"Also, Polly and I are engaged now!"
"Don't worry, you're still my Ohshubi, too!"
Gate
Gate
"I know you have other Ohshubis, darling."
"Don't worry, though. I understand!"
"Love can extend past a single person."
"Just as mine does, so can yours."
Gate
Gate
"Just promise to come visit once in a while."
"Deal?"
Gate
Gate
"I know you have other Ohshubis, darling."
"Don't worry, though. I understand!"
"Love can extend past a single person."
"Just as mine does, so can yours."
Gate
Gate
"Just promise to come visit once in a while."
"Deal?"
Gate
Gate
"I know you have other Ohshubis, darling."
"Don't worry, though. I understand!"
"Love can extend past a single person."
"Just as mine does, so can yours."
Gate
Gate
"Just promise to come visit once in a while."
"Deal?"
Gate
Gate
"I know you have other Ohshubis, darling."
"Don't worry, though. I understand!"
"Love can extend past a single person."
"Just as mine does, so can yours."
Gate
Gate
"Just promise to come visit once in a while."
"Deal?"
Gate
Gate
"Look, I know you've been wanting to..."
"Well, explore your horizons a bit, I'll say."
"There's nothing wrong with it."
"I have multiple Ohshubis, so why not you?"
Gate
Gate
"Just promise to come visit once in a while."
"Deal?"
